summaries.body: An Ohio teenager accused of live-streaming a friend's rape on Periscope faces charges as severe as those against the assailant.

display_asset.caption: Lemi Berhanu Hayle, 21, of Ethiopia, won the men’s division of the Boston Marathon on Monday.

summaries.body: Ethiopians swept the titles at the Boston Marathon, for the first time. Lemi Berhanu Hayle won the men’s race, and Atsede Baysa the women’s.
Families in eastern China are outraged after illnesses at a school, a few as severe as leukemia, were tied to pollution created by former pesticide plants in the area.

display_asset.caption: Angela Collins with her son at home in Port Hope, Ontario. She and her partner are suing a Georgia sperm bank, claiming that it failed to accurately describe the donor they chose.
display_asset.credit: Bernard Weil/Toronto Star, via Getty Images

summaries.body: Three families have filed lawsuits in Ontario accusing a sperm bank in Georgia of failing to disclose that the donor they used had schizophrenia and a criminal record.

display_asset.caption: The actors Johnny Depp and Amber Heard leaving Southport Magistrates Court in Australia on Monday.

summaries.body: The actress Amber Heard pleaded guilty in Australia over bringing undeclared dogs with her last year on a visit to her husband, Johnny Depp. “Protecting Australia is important," she said in a video the couple recorded.

display_asset.caption: Lingerie on display at the “Undressed” exhibition at the Victoria and Albert Museum in London.
display_asset.credit: Anthony Devlin/Press Association, via Associated Press

summaries.body: “Undressed," an exhibition at the Victoria and Albert Museum in London, examines the history of underwear and its role in shaping gender tensions and style trends.
Researchers have found that Dyson hand dryers propel viruses into the air at a higher rate than other dryers, increasing the risk of infection.

display_asset.caption: A stone structure that Luke Irwin had been using as a planter for his geraniums. Archaeologists now believe it to be a child’s coffin that may date from between A.D. 175 and 220.

summaries.body: An English family uncovered a barely touched Roman villa -- complete with all the signs of enormous wealth -- on their property when they were laying electric wiring.

posts.footer: — Jason Pierre-Paul of the New York Giants openly discussed the fireworks accident last year that damaged his right hand. Sports Illustrated

summaries.body: I’m looking at my hand and I’m seeing every ligament. You only see this stuff in the movies.
Moving to compete with Netflix, Amazon is introducing two monthly subscription options to its Prime service. But look closely: The new plans are more expensive.

display_asset.caption: “Time Out of Mind,” an hourlong drama, will include characters and settings drawn from the lyrics of Bob Dylan’s songs.

summaries.body: A Bob Dylan-inspired drama is in the works at Amazon, part of a spate of deals that shows a willingness by music publishers to find new sources of income.

display_asset.caption: An engineer measuring a K-Cup prototype at a Keurig Green Mountain lab in Burlington, Mass.
display_asset.credit: Tony Luong for The New York Times

summaries.body: Keurig Green Mountain said it would soon sell plastic coffee pods made from recyclable material. But the new cups are not compostable, and they are not reusable.
A zookeeper was killed by a Malayan tiger at the Palm Beach Zoo while she was performing a routine procedure, a spokeswoman for the zoo said.

display_asset.caption: A police officer pepper-sprayed students during an Occupy protest at the University of California, Davis in 2011.
display_asset.credit: Wayne Tilcock/The Enterprise, via Associated Press

summaries.body: After students were pepper-sprayed, the University of California, Davis, paid to have negative search engine results suppressed. Does that even work? Read on.

display_asset.caption: Conleth Hill and Peter Dinklage in “Game of Thrones.”

summaries.body: Winter is coming, but it may be shorter. The creators of "Game of Thrones" are considering wrapping up the HBO fantasy series with two abbreviated seasons.
The AMC cinema chain floated the idea of letting people text in theaters, but backed off the idea within a day. Here’s what people thought of the idea. (Not much.)

display_asset.caption: Women outside a shopping mall in Riyadh last year. “Young women are irritated to no end by the religious police,” said Bernard Haykel, a professor of Near Eastern studies at Princeton.
display_asset.credit: Tomas Munita for The New York Times

summaries.body: Saudi Arabia has announced steps to rein in its feared religious police, saying members can no longer detain or pursue suspects, and should be “gentle and kind.”

display_asset.caption: The restoration of the Matrera Castle in southern Spain has drawn comparisons to a botched amateur restoration in 2012 of a nearly century-old fresco of Jesus in the county’s northeast.

summaries.body: Last month, critics mocked the restoration of the Spanish castle of Matrera as a barbarity. Now, a community of architects has honored it with a preservation prize.

display_asset.caption: Helen Clark, a former prime minister of New Zealand and a candidate for secretary general of the United Nations, fielded questions on Thursday. She is one of nine people vying for the job.

summaries.body: Over three days this week, ambassadors interviewed the nine men and women vying to be the next secretary general of the United Nations.

display_asset.caption: The Bushmaster AR-15 rifle used by Adam Lanza in the massacre at Sandy Hook Elementary School. A judge ruled that a lawsuit against the gun’s manufacturer can proceed.

summaries.body: A Connecticut judge ruled that a lawsuit against the manufacturer of the gun used in the Newtown massacre can proceed.

display_asset.credit: Peter DaSilva for The New York Times

summaries.body: The head of AMC Entertainment said he's open to allowing texting in some of his chain’s movie theaters. “You can’t tell a 22-year-old to turn off their cellphone,” he said.

display_asset.caption: Mike Piazza celebrated with teammates after hitting a two-run home run in the New York Mets’ first game after Sept. 11, 2001.

summaries.body: A group reached an agreement to buy a Mets jersey that Mike Piazza wore during the first game held in New York after 9/11. It will be displayed at Citi Field and two museums.
The Hong Kong-based chef behind the cheapest Michelin-starred restaurant in the world is opening a dim sum parlor in New York City.
The Czech Republic, which has long suffered from an identity crisis, is now seeking a snappier name. Its foreign minister has proposed renaming the country Czechia.

display_asset.caption: The campus of Idaho State University in Pocatello.
display_asset.credit: Kim Raff for The New York Times

summaries.body: Federal and local officials are investigating burglaries and hate literature that appear to be targeting Muslim students at Idaho State University in Pocatello.

display_asset.caption: A swarm of crabs found off the Pacific coast of Panama.
display_asset.credit: Jesus G. Pineda/Woods Hole Oceanographic Institution

summaries.body: Marine biologists uncovered a deep-sea swarm of crabs marching along like a zombie horde at the Hannibal Bank Seamount, off the coast of Panama.

display_asset.caption: Jason Sudeikis and Jessica Biel in “The Devil and the Deep Blue Sea.” Ms. Biel is also a producer on the film.

summaries.body: Jason Sudeikis and Jessica Biel discussed their film "The Devil and the Deep Blue Sea," premiering Thursday night at the Tribeca Film Festival.

display_asset.caption: Muslim men at the Baitul Futuh Mosque in London. A new poll revealed views among Britain’s largest religious minority that differed from the greater population’s.

summaries.body: A new poll of British Muslims revealed attitudes on homosexuality and terrorism sharply out of step with public opinion, but set off a debate about survey reliability.
A video shows a chimpanzee named Chacha desperately trying to avoid capture by climbing an electric pole after he fled from a zoo in Japan.

display_asset.caption: Police officers at the site of the shooting of a Houston deputy constable late Wednesday.

summaries.body: A man shot and wounded a deputy constable during a traffic stop in Houston late Wednesday in what the authorities described as an ambush-style attack.
